searchDocs.content: </> interface SignalData { connections: {{ listener: listener, cleanup: cleanup }} }

searchDocs.title: SignalClass​
searchDocs.content: </> interface SignalClass { store: ( signal: Signal, name: string, overwrite: boolean? ) → () unstore: (signal: Signal) → () fire: ( signal: Signal, ...any ) → () connect: ( signal: Signal, listener: function, cleanup: function? ) → () → () once: ( signal: Signal, listener: function, cleanup: function? ) → () → () wait: (signal: Signal) → ...any waitUntil: ( signal: Signal, timeout: number ) → ...any cleanUp: (signal: Signal) → () }

searchDocs.title: store​
searchDocs.content: </> Signal.store( signal: Signal,-- The signal to store. name: string,-- The name to register the signal under. overwrite?: boolean-- Whether to overwrite an existing signal with the same name. ) → () Stores a signal in a global registry by name.

searchDocs.title: unstore​
searchDocs.content: </> Signal.unstore( signal: Signal-- The signal to remove. ) → () Removes a signal from the global registry.

searchDocs.title: getStored​
searchDocs.content: </> Signal.getStored( name: string-- The name of the signal to retrieve. ) → Signal-- The stored signal, or nil if not found. Retrieves a stored signal by name.

searchDocs.title: new​
searchDocs.content: </> Signal.new() → Signal-- The new signal object. Creates a new Signal instance.

searchDocs.title: connect​
searchDocs.content: </> Signal:connect( signal: Signal,-- The signal instance. listener: function,-- The callback function to execute when the signal is fired. cleanup?: function-- An optional cleanup function to run when the connection is disconnected. ) → function-- A function that, when called, disconnects the listener. Connects a listener to the signal.

searchDocs.title: once​
searchDocs.content: </> Signal:once( signal: Signal,-- The signal instance. listener: function,-- The callback function. cleanup?: function-- Optional cleanup function. ) → function-- A function to disconnect the listener before it fires. Connects a listener that will only run once.

searchDocs.title: fire​
searchDocs.content: </> Signal:fire( signal: Signal,-- The signal instance. ...: any-- The arguments to pass to the listeners. ) → () Fires the signal, executing all connected listeners with the provided arguments.

searchDocs.title: wait​
searchDocs.content: </> Signal:wait( signal: Signal-- The signal instance. ) → ...any-- The arguments passed when the signal was fired. Yields the current thread until the signal is fired.

searchDocs.title: waitUntil​
searchDocs.content: </> Signal:waitUntil( signal: Signal,-- The signal instance. timeout: number-- The maximum time to wait in seconds. ) → ...any-- The arguments from the signal, or nil if timed out. Yields until the signal is fired or the timeout is reached.

searchDocs.title: cleanUp​
searchDocs.content: </> Signal:cleanUp( signal: Signal-- The signal instance. ) → () Disconnects all listeners and runs their cleanup functions.
